newsitem.title: USA: Autodesk, Softdesk waiting period extended.
newsitem.headline: Autodesk, Softdesk waiting period extended.

text.p: Autodesk Inc and Softdesk Inc said on Wednesday the U.S. Federal Trade Commission has extended the waiting period under the Hart-Scott-Rodino Antitrust Improvements Act, since the agency is requesting more information about the proposed merger.
Autodesk agreed to acquire Softdesk in December 1996 for $15 a share in Autodesk stock, the design software companies said in a joint statement.

This extension will give the parties sufficient time to negotiate and obtain acceptance by the commission of a proposed consent decree, which will reflect the sale by Softdesk of its IntelliCADD technology to Boomerang Technology Inc on February 21, 1997, the companies said.

Autodesk and Softdesk said they do not expect Federal Trade Commission approval of the proposed consent decree to delay Autodesk's acquisition of Softdesk, which is scheduled to close on or about March 31, 1997.
